page.title: 04Changing Times 1957.
page.content: All the 40 adults in the village worked for the forestry.Some went to work by lorry or cycle but with few roads they walked a lot.Trees were felled with cross_cut saw,snedded with axes and horses pulled timber to the roadside.Workers peeled logs,made pit_props and fencing stobs.Other jobs included draining,planting,brashing and fire_watching.They had no protective clothing.Some workers owned and cared for horses.50 children attended school,only 2 people had cars and 1 a taxi.Villagers organised carpet bowls,dancing with live music,whist drives and fetes.A bus took people to the cinema in Lochgilphead.A travelling cinema came each month .Church and Sunday school were well attended.There was no electricity.Parrafin had to be used.There was a small P.O and shop.
